TopicTitle: A method of selecting a part in the VAB/MAP not pixel dependent

Articles.Content:
I would like to suggest a little requester that pops up when clicking on multiple parts in the VAB that would enable you to select a part that the VAB will not let you click on with the pointer. Many many many many times for each ship I build I need to click on a part and the VAB will not let me unless I find the exact pixel and very often that exact pixel is not in front of any part even though I can see it and my pointer is on it. This means that simply to select a part I have to pull my entire rocket apart, sometimes meaning half an hour of replacing struts and failing to launch many times.

This gets very frustrating when the solution could be so simple.

A small requester that pops up asking me if I was trying to select the strut, tank, engine, RCS thruster or reaction wheel would be great and AFAIK simple to program, you just remove the part that stops you clicking on the parts behind, pull the info on the parts that could possibly have been selected on that z axiz and put all the options on a menu for the user to select instead of insisting on the user clicking on a particular pixel.

I also suggest the same method for the map when many craft are in the same spot and clicking could mean many craft, not just the last drawn or closest to the pointer in z-space.

I have suggested this before and it failed to appear on the `do not suggest` and also the `already suggested` lists. I assume it got missed so here it is again.

I agree with both suggestions. I frequently have this problem in the VAB, especially with strut start points. I have no idea how much work this type of thing would require, but it would greatly improve the VAB/map experience.
